name: Introduction to Numismatics
description: This course is an introduction to the field of numismatics, the study of coins, tokens, and paper money. Students will learn about the history, physical properties, and value of coins and other forms of currency.

name: Ancient Numismatics
description: This course is an exploration of the coins, tokens, and paper money of ancient societies, including Ancient Greece and Rome. The course focuses on the types of coins issued, the physical properties of coins, and the symbolism and meaning behind them.

name: Medieval and Early Modern Numismatics
description: This course examines coins, tokens, and paper money from Medieval and Early Modern Europe. Topics covered include the development of coinage in Europe, the circulation of coins, and the symbolism and meaning behind coins from this period.

name: Modern Numismatics
description: This course is an exploration of coins, tokens, and paper money from the 18th century to the present day. It covers the development of modern numismatic systems, as well as the symbolism and meaning behind modern coins.
